messages: d14501081968ac6c4c1ee55a835b7e5e (21:21): CSS nerdy question:
d14501081968ac6c4c1ee55a835b7e5e (21:21): how do i style the first child of a container's first line in all caps?
3aa4c68c2ceb0521f6c25f50e2e0950e (21:21): Lines don't have children.
3aa4c68c2ceb0521f6c25f50e2e0950e (21:22): (At least, not in the element tree, which is where Selectors operate.)
3aa4c68c2ceb0521f6c25f50e2e0950e (21:22): Or... wait.  I think I misparsed your sentence.
3aa4c68c2ceb0521f6c25f50e2e0950e (21:22): #container > :first-child::first-line should work
3aa4c68c2ceb0521f6c25f50e2e0950e (21:23): That'll select the ((first child of a container)'s first line), but not the (first child of (a container's first line)).
3aa4c68c2ceb0521f6c25f50e2e0950e (21:24): And then, of course, text-transform: uppercase;.

3aa4c68c2ceb0521f6c25f50e2e0950e (21:25): d14501081968ac6c4c1ee55a835b7e5e: Also, your request is a heisen-sentence.  It can be read either way, and swapping the order of the "first *" clauses is equally ambiguous.
d14501081968ac6c4c1ee55a835b7e5e (21:26): 3aa4c68c2ceb0521f6c25f50e2e0950e: i mean the former not the latter
d14501081968ac6c4c1ee55a835b7e5e (21:26): ((first child of a container)'s first line)
3aa4c68c2ceb0521f6c25f50e2e0950e (21:26): K, then my selector will work.
d14501081968ac6c4c1ee55a835b7e5e (21:26): sadly not working in mobile safari
3aa4c68c2ceb0521f6c25f50e2e0950e (21:26): That'll be a bug, then.
3aa4c68c2ceb0521f6c25f50e2e0950e (21:28): What's the failure?  It doesn't work at all?  It selects more than you think?  Less than you think?
d14501081968ac6c4c1ee55a835b7e5e (21:41): 3aa4c68c2ceb0521f6c25f50e2e0950e: it doesn't work at all
d14501081968ac6c4c1ee55a835b7e5e (21:41): 3aa4c68c2ceb0521f6c25f50e2e0950e: it selects nothing
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:42): is the child a block?
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:44): hey guys
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:44): I have a question about window.onpopstate
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:45): I am not clear about what the expected behavior is
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:45): in chrome/firefox4 popstates fires for the initial page load
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:45): in safari it doesn't
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:45): I read this: http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2010Nov/0078.html
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:46): but I am not sure I understand it :D
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:46): if anyone cares to enlighten me that would be great
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:48): Say, you click a link
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:48): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/text-level-semantics.html#the-a-element
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:48): Finally, the user agent must follow the hyperlink
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:48): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/links.html#following-hyperlinks
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:49): wait what?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:49): ... must navigate a browsing context to the resulting absolute URL.
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:49): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/history.html#navigate
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:50): wait sorry, I don't really want to read through all the specs if thats ok
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:50): just want to know what the expected behavior for popstate is
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:50): should it fire on the initial page load or not
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:50): that is, if I navigate to example.com from an empty tab
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:50): should it fire popstate or not?
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:50): chrome/ff4 do, safari does not
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:50): any maybe because its friday night I am not fully able to understand that response in the bug tracker
4a0608b7adbe8a619a225f392ce5a56e (21:56): ok thanks
